# Intro

The English Premier League (EPL) pre-season is underway. Burnley are the earliest to get going whilst Chelsea will be the latest to do their work due to their FIFA Club World Cup exploits. There's no doubt that pre-season matters a lot to managers and clubs. Exactly how it matters is another question. What is clear is that it's vital preparation ahead of a gruelling season to come. It's a time for fitness, opportunities for youth, team bonding, squad building and tactical trials among other things. Match outcomes are largely meaningless, but can influence the narrative, tone and group morale heading into the new campaign. So far over 90 pre-season matches are scheduled for EPL clubs. <br> <br>This post summarizes pre-season schedules for each EPL team ahead of the 2025/2026 campaign that begins on August 15th 2025. Updates will be provided periodically.

::: {.callout-important appearance="default"}

## ![](images/arsenal.svg){width="30"} Arsenal

Arsenal began their pre-season preparations on July 9th, followed by a training camp in Spain. They will tour Singapore and Hong Kong. A total of 6 pre-season games are currently scheduled.

```{r message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}

#| warning: false
#| echo: false
#| fig-height: 10
#| fig-width: 15
#| fig-dpi: 600
#| column: 600

library(reactablefmtr)
library(htmltools)
library(tidyverse)
library(reactable)


### load data
data <- read.csv(file = "data/arsenal_ps.csv")

arsenal <- reactable(data,
  theme = fivethirtyeight(),
  ### add column group header
  showSortIcon = FALSE,
  searchable = FALSE,
  highlight = TRUE,
  language = reactableLang(
    searchPlaceholder = "SEARCH FOR A PLAYER OR TEAM..."),
  columns = list(
    date = colDef(show = TRUE, align = "center", maxWidth = 75),
    score = colDef(show = TRUE, align = "center", maxWidth = 75),
    team = colDef(show = FALSE),
    opponent = colDef(show = TRUE),
    team_logo = colDef(show = FALSE),
    location = colDef(show = TRUE, align = "center"),
    opta_rating = colDef(show = FALSE, name = "opponent Opta Rating", align = "center"),
    match_report = colDef(name = "Match Report",
                          align = "center",
                          maxWidth = 110,
                     cell = function(value, index) {
                     url <- value 
                     htmltools::tags$a(href = url, target = "_blank", as.character("Report"))
                     }), # end of Link definition
    #opponent_logo = colDef(show = TRUE, align = "left", maxWidth = 300,
                  #style = cell_style(data, font_size = 15, font_color = "gray")),
    #team_logo = colDef(
    #  name = "",
    #  maxWidth = 25,
    # align = "center",
    #  cell = embed_img(height = "25", width = "42.5")),
    opponent_logo = colDef(
      name = "",
      maxWidth = 25,
      align = "center",
      cell = embed_img(height = "25", width = "42.5")),
    ### add icons using icon_assign()
    ### add bars using data_bars_pos_neg()
    note = colDef(
      maxWidth = 900,
      align = "center",
      cell = data_bars(
        data,
        fill_color = c("#fd84a9", "#fee6ed", "#d9f2f4", "#42c2ca"),
        number_fmt = scales::number_format(accuracy = 0.1)
      ),
      style = list(borderLeft = "1px dashed rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.3)")
    )
  )
)%>% 
  google_font(font_family = "Monda")%>%
  add_title("Arsenal pre-season schedule", font_size = 22)%>%
  #add_subtitle("Pre-season schedule")%>%
  add_source("", font_size = 12)

arsenal


```
